intro: Centaurea omphalodes, commonly known as the blueweed or common centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of western Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to violet flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers are surrounded by bracts that give the appearance of a crown, contributing to its common name. Centaurea omphalodes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
